Ingredients.6: 1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers

Ingredients.7: 1 medium Roma tomato, cored and diced

Ingredients.9: 1 medium jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped

Directions.1: Line a 16-ounce bowl with plastic wrap, allowing excess to hang over the sides.

Directions.2: Combine cream cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, and taco seasoning in a food processor; process until well combined. Add green onions, ½ of the cilantro leaves, and green chiles and pulse until well combined with flecks of green; do not fully process.

Directions.3: Transfer cheese mixture to the lined bowl and press to smooth. Cover and refrigerator for at least 4 hours or up to 8 hours or overnight.

Directions.4: Invert cheese onto a serving platter and remove plastic. Use a small shot glass or spoon to create a hole in the center of the cheese to form a wreath shape.

Directions.5: Finely chop remaining cilantro leaves and lightly cover the top of the cheese. Combine tomato, onion, and jalapeno in a small bowl and place over the cilantro in a 1-inch ring around the wreath.
